Description: Costumes Egyptiens, one of three studies for Plate 101 of the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; two studies of women, one wearing a robe and veil which covers the face, exposing her eyes, the other wearing a turban and holding a fan (?) Pen and black ink, with grey wash, over graphite
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by Jean Duplessi-Bertaux. This drawing relates to image 8 of Plate 101. There are no drawings for six of the images in this Plate. There is no copy of Denon's 'Voyage...' in the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12. The minutes of the Trustees' meeting on 12th December, 1835, record that "two or three" of the drawings were missing when the group was offered to the Museum.
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
